bug.author: IronPan
bug.summary: Outdated usage report message in kfctl with kustomize
bug.description:
Saw following error message when running <denchmark-code>kfctl generate all -V --zone ${ZONE} </denchmark-code>
Building kfctl from head(<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/tree/31a9bb666a13e3aea60f9a246574db27f2ee9d05>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/tree/31a9bb666a13e3aea60f9a246574db27f2ee9d05</denchmark-link> ) which uses kustomize. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Notice anonymous usage reporting enabled using spartakus To disable it If you have already deployed it run the following commands: cd $(pwd) ks delete default -c spartakus kubectl -n ${K8S_NAMESPACE} delete deploy -l app=spartakus Then run the following command to remove it from your ksonnet app: ks component rm spartakus For more info: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/guides/usage-reporting/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/guides/usage-reporting/</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.91. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! <denchmark-link:https://github.com/xauthulei>@xauthulei</denchmark-link> committed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kfctl/pull/9>kubeflow/kfctl#9</denchmark-link>
However, kubeflow/kubeflow is still source of truth for kfctl; so we need to get that PR cherry-picked onto kubeflow/kubeflow so the changes don't get overwritten on the next sync of kubeflow/kubeflow to kubeflow/kfctl /assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/xauthulei>@xauthulei</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> : GitHub didn't allow me to assign the following users: xauthulei. Note that only <denchmark-link:https://github.com/orgs/kubeflow/people>kubeflow members</denchmark-link> , repo collaborators and people who have commented on this issue/PR can be assigned. Additionally, issues/PRs can only have 10 assignees at the same time. For more information please see <denchmark-link:https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/#issue-assignment-in-github>the contributor guide</denchmark-link>
In response to this:
@xauthulei committed kubeflow/kfctl#9 However, kubeflow/kubeflow is still source of truth for kfctl; so we need to get that PR cherry-picked onto kubeflow/kubeflow so the changes don't get overwritten on the next sync of kubeflow/kubeflow to kubeflow/kfctl /assign @xauthulei
Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available here. If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the kubernetes/test-infra repository.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> , I commit my fixes in PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3941>#3941</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xauthulei>@xauthulei</denchmark-link> Thank you so much. Just one more thing. After <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3941>#3941</denchmark-link> is merged can you follow these <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/hack/cherry-picks.md>instructions</denchmark-link> to cherry-pick it onto the v0.6-branch. Its just a simple script you have to run to auto-create a PR with the same changes.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> , I will try to do it later. Thanks.

@xauthulei Thank you so much. Just one more thing. After #3941 is merged can you follow these instructions to cherry-pick it onto the v0.6-branch. Its just a simple script you have to run to auto-create a PR with the same changes.
It is done , see PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3942>#3942</denchmark-link> , Could you review that. Many Thanks.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3941>#3941</denchmark-link> has been merged so I'm closing this out.
